III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section Health services; policies and procedures.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation In April and May of 2025, a youth was taking two medications that
were not prescribed to them.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 6/3/2025.
Complainant did not provide any further information.
Nurse 1 was interviewed via phone on 6/3/2025. Nurse 1 reported
awareness of a medication error for Youth A over a period of 28
days. Nurse 1 reported the error was discovered in an audit which
found that medication was administered to Youth A for 28 days
without a prescription. Nurse 1 was not sure how the error could
have occurred.
Psychiatrist was interviewed via phone on 6/11/2025.
Psychiatrist reported awareness of the medication error at the
facility. Psychiatrist reported Youth A had never been prescribed
the medications that were administered during that time frame.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face on 6/12/2025. Youth A
reported being aware there were days he received the wrong
medication because he was told about it. Youth A could not
remember who told him it happened. Youth A denied having any
side-effects from receiving the wrong medication. Youth A
reported he is currently prescribed Benedryl, Seroquel, and Luvox
however he does not know what they are for. Youth A reported
that Psychiatrist handles what medication he is on and the
nurses at the facility give out the medication.
Documentation Review:
• Medication Error Report documents error of administering
Youth A Zyprexa 10 mg and Remeron 30 mg from 4/18/25-
5/13/25. Report states there is no medication order for these
medications for Youth A.
• Medication Orders for Youth A dated 4/3/25, 4/15/25,
4/21/25, 5/1/25, 5/6/25, 5/7/25, 5/12/25 document prescribed
medications to be Luvox, Seroquel, Metadate, Melatonin,
and Atarax.
• Medication Order dated 5/11/25 document Ibuprofen.
• Medication Administration Records regarding Youth A
document Rameron and Zyprexa being administered.
• Use of Pharmaceuticals and Medication Administration/Non-
Compliance and Notification Policy/Procedure states that all
medications must be ordered by the responsible health care
2

provider. Procedure further states that the order must be
reviewed before it is administered.
Analysis A violation is established regarding this allegation. It was reported
and is documented that Rameron and Zyprexa was administered
to Youth A from 4/18/25-5/13/25 and these medications were not
prescribed to Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001741, CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
